trial_identification.studytitle: Delayed versus immediate urethral catheterization following instillation of local anaesthetic gel in males: a Randomized Clinical Trial
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Pain experienced with delayed versus immediate urethral catheterization following instillation of local anaesthetic gel in males with urinary retention or the need for monitoring of urine output: a Randomized Clinical Trial

conditions.healthcondition: Urinary retention, and the need for monitoring of urine output

interventions.interventions: Following the instillation of standard local anaesthetic gel (lignocaine) into the urethra, participants will be catheterised immediately.
interventions.comparator: Following the instillation of standard local anaesthetic gel (lignocaine) into the urethra, participants will be catheterised following a 2-minute delay.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The pain of catheterisation experienced during the procedure

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Adverse events, for example bleeding, failure to catheterise.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: These will be measured immediately following the procedure.

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Allergy to lignocaine, known abnormal urethral anatomy, inability to assess pain (altered mental state, dementia, language barrier), significant illness associated with pain or discomfort, trauma patients, spinal patients, patients who have received narcotic analgesia in previous 4 hours, patient refusal or inability to give consent.

trial_design.sequence: Block randomisation for each of four sites, as generated by computer software

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
We aim to show if introducing a delay between instillation of local anaesthetic gel into the urethra and the performance of catheterisation produces less discomfort than immediate catheterisation.
The assessor who administers the pain scale rating will be blinded to the assignment of the patient (delayed or immediate catheterisation). The participant and proceduralist will not be blinded to the assignment.

contact.name: Robert Garbutt
contact.address: Royal Melbourne Hospital Grattan Street Parkville VIC 3052
